job description:
Prospect 33 is looking to add a number of analytically minded professionals to a growing team within Global Markets in Raleigh, NC. The team is co located across New York and North Carolina with senior management across both offices.

As we help define the current state of the organizations Data Strategy it is important that the candidates have strong interpersonal skills coupled with a background comfortable dealing with large data sets. As you will be working in a global environment, documentation skills will be at the forefront. It is highly preferred that you bring prior FS knowledge, preferably working for a larger banking organization.

The role is for a data analyst within the Data Analytics team who will be focused on;
  • You will be designing and building business intelligence report and visualizations to meet business stakeholders requirements.
  • You will be co-ordinating and supporting education, training and up-skilling of wider GM Operations team around data and analytics.
  • You will be collaborating with a variety of business and IT departments to overcome challenges faced through the implementation and maintenance of this capability.
  • You will be implementing new statistical or other mathematical methodologies as needed for specific models or analysis.
  • You will be optimizing joint development efforts through appropriate database use and project design.
Responsibilities include;
  • Design and build business intelligence report and visualizations to meet business stakeholders requirements.
  • Co-ordinate and support education, training and up-skilling of wider GM Operations team around data and analytics.
  • Collaborate with a variety of business and IT departments to overcome challenges faced through the implementation and maintenance of this capability.
  • Keep up-to-date with latest technology trends.
  • Implement new statistical or other mathematical methodologies as needed for specific models or analysis.
  • Optimize joint development efforts through appropriate database use and project design.
#LI-CF1
